results.title: Heather's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The youngest clerical worker in a project team is angry about staff who are inconsiderate, messy and who avoid her whilst her colleagues have complained to the new supervisor about her being aggressive. The supervisor attempts to resolve the problem and then Peter Quarry assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.

results.title: Heat treatment of aluminum. Part 2
results.brief_description: Explains the nature of cold working operations; crystalline structure of aluminum alloys; slip planes and deformation; microstructure changes during cold working; microstructure changes during annealing; cold working operations; and annealing operations.

results.title: Heat treatment of aluminum. Part 1
results.brief_description: Explains the purpose of heat treatment; micro-structure changes during heat treatment; heat treatment procedure; precipitation hardening; and the effects of heat treatment on the physical properties of aluminum.

results.title: Heat rays
results.brief_description: Instructional film analysing the relationship between heat and light radiation; the sun as a source of light and heat, making a photograph with light and heat rays; applications and uses of heat rays; reflection, refraction and movement of heat rays; applications of these properties of heat rays to everyday life; relationships between heat and light as a form of vibration of electro-magnetic waves of different frequencies; the role of heat rays in maintaining life on this planet.

results.title: Heat causes expansion
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows two children carrying out experiments in their home to prove that solids, liquids and gases expand when heated. Also shows many ways in which this law of physics occurs in everyday life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Heat and dust
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: A young English woman journeys to India to explore the mysterious and scandalous past of her Great-aunt sixty years ago. Both succumb to the beauty of the land and its people and become pregnant. Nevertheless, they remain outsiders in a land they can never fully comprehend. Stars Julie Christie, Greta Scacchi and Madhur Jaffrey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Feature films → Feature films - Great Britain

results.title: Heat = Andy Warhol presents Heat
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Andy Warhol and Score Movies
results.brief_description: Largely interpreted as a send-up of “Sunset Boulevard”, this is the story of Joe (Joe Dallesandro) a handsome, ambitious would-be actor who, whilst staying in a shoddy LA Motel, sleeps with an array of staff and customers, anyone in fact who he believes will further his career. Joe displays all the hallmarks of a jaded hustler - a man beyond enjoyment of sex, but one for whom sex is the main currency. The final instalment of the “Flesh/Trash/Heat” trilogy, between Paul Morrissey, Joe Dallesandro and Andy Warhol, this is the most linear of their work and the least experimental. It contains some wonderfully satirical humour whilst remaining focused (as “Heat” and “Trash” did also) on Dallesandro’s physical beauty. Cast also includes Sylvia Miles, Ray Vestal, Andrea Feldman and Pat Ast.

results.title: Heat
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Art Linson, Regency Entertainment (USA) and Monarchy Enterprises B. V.
results.brief_description: Neil McCauley (Robert De Niro) is a professional. He is meticulous and cautious. He also is a professional robber. After a successful heist, LA cop Vincent Hanna (Al Pacino) is on McCauley’s trail and out to stop him. The two are soon caught in an epic battle and yet they recognise that they are actually essentialy the same. Michael Mann’s “Heat” is a rivetting action film which also attempts to examine in some depth the lives of the film’s characters, in particular Vincent and Neil as well as the other members of his team. By casting dynamic actors like De Niro and Pacino in the lead roles, as well as Val Kilmer and John Voight in supporting roles, the focus on character remains engaging in the midst of the explosive violence of the action sequences which drive the film along.
